page.title: 17THE GOSPORT LINES
page.content: This is the name given to the {defensive}line built around the town of Gosport to defend the western side of Portsmouth Harbour. Work was started in the 17th. century and the lines were altered and strengthened in the 19th. century. Today, only two small sections of {The Lines}can be seen; one in Clarence Yard, belonging to the M.O.D., the other by Haslar Bridge and open to the public. We visited the latter section, officially known as{Bastion One}but commonly known as Vicar's Bank because of Trinity Church Vicarage inside the bastion. {The Ramparts,}which we estimate to be about five metres high, are very impressive.
